subject: Mental Health
title: Gender Differences in Anxiety
description: Learn Gender Differences in Anxiety in one minute.

hook.text: Women are diagnosed with anxiety disorders at roughly twice the rate of men.

buildup.text: Hormonal shifts during menstruation, pregnancy, and menopause play a role.

discovery.text: Men experience anxiety too but are far less likely to report or seek help.

twist.text: Cultural expectations push men to mask anxiety as anger or substance use.

climax.text: The gap may reflect biology, socialization, and diagnosis bias combined.

punchline.text: Different expression doesn't mean less pain.

quiz.question: Why might men be underdiagnosed for anxiety?
